questions.text: In a population of 1000, 500 were smokers. Among smokers 20 developed CVD and among non-smokers 5 developed CVD. What is risk ratio?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Incidence among exposed IE = 20/500

Incidence among exposed INE = 5/500

Risk ratio is relative risk

So RR= IE / INE

RR= (20/500)/(5/500)

RR=4

questions.text: The disease shown in the image is caused by RNA paramyxovirus. What is of the following is least likely a complication?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

•    Image shown is a classical feature of mumps. Mumps is caused by myxovirus parotiditis, a RNA paramyxovirus.

•    Salivary gland involvement especially parotid is a common clinical feature.

questions.text: Total calories required for a moderate worker pregnant female?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

According to recent nutritional guidelines total calories required by a moderate female is 2130 kilocalorie and during pregnancy extra 350 kilo calories are required so 2480 kilo calories required in the given situation so correct answer here will be 2500

questions.text: Time taken for a person from receipt of infection to development of maximum effectivity is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

•    Incubation period is the time interval between invasion of an infectious agent and appearance of its first sign or symptom

•    Generation time is time taken for a person from receipt of infection to development of maximum infectivity.

•    Serial interval is the gap in onset between primary case and secondary case

•    Period of communicability is the time during which an infectious agent can be transferred from an infected person to another person.

questions.text: A new screening test shows that out of 100 disease population, 20% are positive and out of 100 non-disease population 90% are negative. Find Sensitivity?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Sensitivity = TP/TP+FN

Sensitivity = 20/20+80

So

Sensitivity = 20%

questions.text: A case control study was carried out in Delhi. Out of 100 lung cancer patients, 20 gave history of smoking and out of 100 controls 10 gave history of smoking. Find odds ratio?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Odds ratio is a cross product ratio

OR=AD/BC

OR=20*90/10*80

OR=2.25

questions.text: Which of the following depicts strongest correlation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

‘r’ is correlation coefficient it can never be more than +1 and less than -1

Her strongest correlation is -0.9.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about ESI Act?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Benefits to employees under ESI

1.    Full medical care

2.    Sickness benefit: 70% of average daily wages payable for 91 days

3.    Extended sickness benefit: 80% of daily wages payable for 2 years this is for selected 34 diseases

4.    Enhance sickness benefit: in case of vasectomy full daily wages for 7 days and in case of tubectomy full daily wages for 14 days

5.    Maternity benefit: full daily wages for 26 weeks

6.    Temporary disablement benefit: 90% wages till recovery

7.    Permanent disablement benefit: 90% wages

8.    Funeral expenses: ₹15,000

questions.text: Which of the following is true about factories act?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Factories act:

i.    Employment prohibited for age less than 14

ii.    15 to 18 years can work between 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM after declared fit by certified surgeon

iii.    one safety officer per 1000 workers

iv.    One welfare officer per 500 workers

v.    one canteen for greater than 250 workers

vi.    One creche per more than 30 women workers

questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

•    Farmer’s lung is caused by mouldy hay

•    Siderosis is caused by iron dust

•    Bagassosis is caused by molasses (sugarcane)

•    Byssinosis is caused by cotton fibre
